intro: Crotalaria excisa subsp. namaquensis, commonly known as the Namakwa crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant features distinctive, palmate leaves with a deep green color and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. The plant is often found in sandy soils and is part of the legume family, Fabaceae.
